arm_group.description: 2 capsules containing 100mg mixed tocotrienols per capsule taken orally once a day for 6 months
2 capsules containing soya bean oil taken orally once a day for 6 months

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine if tocotrienol supplementation given to school
      going children with ADHD will result in reduction of their ADHD symptoms.

clinical_study.brief_title: Tocotrienols for School-going Children With ADHD

detailed_description.textblock:
The main objective of the study is to:

      a. Determine if supplementation of tocotrienol compared to placebo has an effect on the
      symptoms of school going children with ADHD.

      The secondary objective is to:

        1. Determine if supplementation of tocotrienol compared to placebo has an effect on the
           dose of current medication used in school going children with ADHD.

        2. Determine the safety of tocotrienol in the study population.

        3. Determine if tocotrienol levels in children with ADHD correlate with their symptom
           scores.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Diagnosed with ADHD in accordance with the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual (DSM) IV
             criteria.

          -  Be able to swallow soft gel capsules.

          -  If already on medication for ADHD, the dose of the medication must be stable for the
             last 3months

          -  Be able to attend all follow up visits.

          -  Be agreeable to have their teacher score the National Initiative for Children's
             Healthcare Quality (NICHQ) Vanderbilt Assessment Scale - Teacher Informant

          -  Be willing to have their blood taken 3 times during the study.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  ADHD caused by syndromes, inborn errors of metabolism, or structural brain lesions.

          -  Co-existing chronic liver disease

          -  Current use of anticoagulant or antiplatelet drugs.

intervention.description: Capsules containing soya bean oil that has similar appearance with the mixed tocotrienol capsules

facility.name: Child & Adolescent Psychiatry Unit, Hospital Pulau Pinang

clinical_study.official_title: Tocotrienols Supplementation in School Going Children With Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder(ADHD) - A Randomized Controlled Trial

primary_outcome.measure: ADHD symptom scores as measured by NICHQ Vanderbilt Parent and Teacher Assessment Scales
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change of total symptom scores from baseline at 6 months

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the dose of current medication for ADHD
Number of participants with adverse reaction

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
